PARAGRAPH.STRING: (born April 3, 1925), known as Tony Benn, formerly 2nd Viscount Stansgate, is a British politician on the left of the Labour Party.
was instrumental in the creation of the Peerage Act 1963. The term "Bennite", generally understood to mean a radical left-wing position of corporatist but compassionate socialism, was derived from
is known as one of very few politicians to become more left-wing after having held ministerial office.
